sentences.english: Numerous heroes lived on both sides of the Yellow River.
sentences.chinese: 黄河两岸诞生了无数的英雄豪杰。

sentences.english: Everyone is great , there is no hero.
sentences.chinese: 人人都伟大，世间没豪杰。

sentences.english: Rong Zuer is all along fast talk sharp words, so - called recreation encircles medium female hero.
sentences.chinese: 容祖儿一向快言快语，号称娱乐圈中的女豪杰。

sentences.english: Queen, as true to womanhood as Queenhood.
sentences.chinese: 女王，你才是正真的女中豪杰。

sentences.english: North and south of the River How many warriors died!
sentences.chinese: 一江南北，消磨多少豪杰。

sentences.english: That is why our nation has continually pouring countless heroes.
sentences.chinese: 正因为这样我们中华民族才不断涌出无数的英雄豪杰。

sentences.english: Can afford to put it down, is a hero.
sentences.chinese: 拿得起，放得下，是为豪杰。

sentences.english: Chivalrous men in ancient times did good deeds and destroyed evil, all of them were heroes.
sentences.chinese: 古代的大侠扬善除恶，个个都是英雄豪杰。

sentences.english: We prefer to die a hero, rather than live a slave.
sentences.chinese: 宁为豪杰而死，舶讵仆隶死。

sentences.english: He was more hero than scoundred.
sentences.chinese: 他是豪杰，没有是大暴徒。

sentences.english: “The Magnificent Seven, ” as the team called themselves, won the bronze medal.
sentences.chinese: 她们的球队称自己为“七豪杰”。

definition: outstanding talent/wise and able person/illustrious individual
outstanding heroes/warlords vying for supremacy (in former times)/stars (of sports or pop music)
famous scholar/worthy/celebrity, esp. distinguished literary person having no official post
fierce general/valiant military leader/fig. brave individual
a rank growth of grass/uncultivated land/wilderness
